title: CPI Shows Pace of US Inflation Likely to Keep Fed Cautious on Rate Cuts
summary: The central bank is likely to lower borrowing costs at its meeting next week amid budding concerns about the labor market.

title: In Public and in Private, New York Marks 9/11 Anniversary
summary: The names of those killed in the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks are being read at a memorial plaza in Lower Manhattan. Other remembrances are taking place across the region.

title: What to Know About the 9/11 Case at Guantánamo Bay
summary: A guide to the military prison, the prisoners, the costs and what else goes on at the U.S. naval base.

title: On Ukraine and Gaza, Trump Casts Himself as a Bystander, if He Can’t Be a Peacemaker
summary: President Trump often insists he can bring peace to global conflicts. But when allies and adversaries alike appear to be ignoring him or testing American will, he adopts a what-can-you-do shrug.

title: Russia’s Strategy Against the West: Escalate Slowly and See if It Responds
summary: Ukrainian and European officials say President Vladimir V. Putin has become emboldened by a lack of Western pushback.

title: How the Emmys Face-Off Between ‘Severance’ and ‘The Pitt’ Sums Up the TV Business
summary: The industry is in a state of transition. The front-runners for best drama at the Emmys this Sunday explain the competing tensions.

title: Did a Brooklyn Couple Kill a Neighbor’s Trees for a Better View in Maine?
summary: Maine’s Board of Pesticides Control says two summer residents poisoned a neighbor’s trees so the couple, both Martha Stewart associates, could have a harbor view. They deny it.

title: The Jarring Contradiction at the Heart of Kennedy’s Agenda
summary: The health secretary has begun a full-on assault against vaccines but has taken a more restrained approach to pesticides and unhealthy foods, also MAHA priorities.

title: For National Guard Troops in D.C., It’s Trash Pickup and Metro Patrols
summary: Thousands of armed troops are deployed as part of President Trump’s crime crackdown. So far, it has been a lot of beautification projects and assisting the local police.

title: In South Korea and Japan, Fury at U.S. Fuels Backlash Over Trade Deals
summary: Officials and business leaders in both countries are questioning commitments their governments made to invest hundreds of billions in American manufacturing.

title: South Korean Leader Warns of U.S. Investments After Hyundai-LG Plant Raid
summary: President Lee Jae Myung made the comments as hundreds of South Korean workers swept in an immigration raid were expected to fly home on Thursday.

title: Trump’s Tariffs on Brazil and Vietnam Are Making Coffee More Expensive
summary: Coffee prices are up nearly 21 percent over the past year, partly because of President Trump’s punishing tariffs on Brazil and Vietnam.

title: Mamdani Gets Backing From National Democrats as Trump Enters Fray
summary: Democrats have been slow to embrace Zohran Mamdani, the democratic socialist who won New York City’s mayoral primary. Many, especially in New York, still are.

title: Eric Adams Hints to Business Leaders He Is Open to Quitting Mayor’s Race
summary: Mayor Eric Adams told a prominent New York City business group that if a private poll showed he had no path to re-election, he would reconsider bowing out.

title: U.K. Ambassador to U.S., Peter Mandelson, Fired Over Epstein Links
summary: The British government said it withdrew the envoy after newly revealed emails showed the depth of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Democrats Want JPMorgan and Other Banks to Testify Over Epstein Ties
summary: Ten Democratic senators called on the Senate Banking Committee to hold hearings into the role that financial institutions may have played in enabling Jeffrey Epstein’s sex crimes.

title: What Drove Israel’s Brazen Attack on Hamas in Qatar?
summary: Israeli officials and analysts say that revenge for the Hamas-led 2023 attack on Israel, and frustration over moribund Gaza truce negotiations, informed the decision to strike in Doha.

title: California Passes Bill Allowing Omission of Patients’ Names From Abortion Pill Bottles
summary: The intent is to protect health care providers who send the pills to patients in states with abortion bans, and to reassure patients who fear they could be identified.

title: Nadine Menendez, Wife of a Senator, Sentenced to 4 1/2 Years for Bribery Scheme
summary: Ms. Menendez, the wife of former Senator Robert Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat, said her husband had led her astray.

title: Charlie Kirk and the Future of Political Violence
summary: An assassin took aim at the American experiment itself.

title: Charlie Kirk Was Practicing Politics the Right Way
summary: The foundation of a free society is the ability to participate in politics without fear of violence. To lose that is to risk losing everything.

title: What You Need to Know About Charlie Kirk’s Assassination
summary: The search for the shooter is still underway.

title: Belarus Frees 52 Political Prisoners and Gets a Warm Thank-You From Trump
summary: The release came as Aleksandr Lukashenko, the country’s authoritarian leader and an ally of President Vladimir Putin of Russia, seeks to normalize ties with the Trump administration.

title: Nepal’s Young Protesters Find an Unlikely Partner: The Army
summary: After an explosion of popular rage tore through the country, its respected army was the only institution left standing. It’s now in talks with the protesters.

title: Their Schools Banned Phones. Out Came the iPods and Cassette Players.
summary: Enterprising students have been bringing the contraband of yesteryear to school in what they see as a “loophole” in cellphone bans.

title: Small Businesses Face a New Threat: Pay Up or Be Flooded With Bad Reviews
summary: Movers, roofing companies and others are being bombarded with phony one-star reviews on Google Maps. Then they’re asked to pay up.
